newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-ITALIAN STRIKER GIVES UP FOR ART'S SAKE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ITALIAN STRIKER GIVES UP FOR ART'S SAKE.

text.p: Italian professional Pierpaolo Curti, a striker for serie C club Fiorenzuola, said on Wednesday he was giving up full-time soccer because it was cramping his style as an aspiring artist.

"My lifetime's ambition was to play as a professional. I have achieved that dream but it has been a rude awakening," he said. "I realised that a part of me had been wiped out. Too much soccer was stifling my creativity as an artist."
Club sources said Curti, who wanted to go back to being an amateur soccer player, had held several exhibitions of his paintings and was known in local artistic circles.
"Pierpaolo has made his decision and we can do nothing to change it," said Fiorenzuola manager Riccardo Francani. "It's a shame because we had great hopes for him.
"He was our bet on the transfer market, having scored 36 goals last season with Soresinese in the amateur league. In the third division he was already showing his quality."
